reviews.review_text: As a tourist, I wanted to get a quick bite somewhere with Poutine and a nice view. I got this and more! The bartender was so sweet. She was so patient with me and gave me awesome drink recommendations.  I ended up with a cider and did try the IPAs. The soup and salad were fresh and delicious.  I believe it was a chicken curry soup. I then ordered the Poutine with bacon and mushrooms. Very tasty! I loved how the place was right across the Gastown steam clock. So I was able to hear the steam go off while enjoying my meal and the view. If I ever come back to Vancouver, I will go out of my way to eat here again!

While visiting Vancouver in 2018, we stopped at the corner of Water Street & Cambie and the Gastown Steam Clock. After taking some of the usual tourist photos & waiting for the steam to blow the whistle, we found our way to the Black Frog Eatery. Settling in at 1 pm we were warmly welcomed and quickly seated. From our table we had an excellent view of the Steam Clock. I watched tourists posing with the clock as we awaited our order. We weren t very hungry and decided to share a club sandwich.  I m happy to say that it was made with real meat none of that sliced processed poultry!  The fries were good too, and I washed it all down with a local award-winning Kokanee lager. The ambiance of the Black Frog is definitely that of a pub-style eatery and the decor accentuates that feel.  That s a good thing, and to me, very comforting. Lot s of wood, brick, and pub-style elements all around. This is absolutely the type of place I d have lunch at if I d worked in the area.  Their menu has a good selection to satisfy everyone s tastes. Prices are on par with other restaurants offering similar fare.  The type of place that I call  no nonsense and basic good eating . Service was prompt, efficient, and the staff knew their menu well. When we find our way back to Vancouver, I will certainly plan on coming back.

WOW!!! This charming bar is a stones throw away from the gas town steam clock - which is how we noticed it. We just wanted appetizers and a beer to bide some time. The staff was incredibly helpful in picking the best drink on the menu (for me), and we had the  yorkies  which were miniature Yorkshire pies. They were INCREDIBLE!!! Such a lovely unassuming spot. I cannot recommend enough!

Amazing spot! Great owner, great people. The food is wonderful and beers are flowin  just right. Make sure to stop in and get the poutine and  Creepy Uncle Dunkle . I love this place. Right by the steam clock too!

Delicious food with reasonable price and excellent customer service! I would recommend trying their buffalo cauliflower. I don t drink so didn t check out their beverage menu. You can have steam clock view from patio.
Right next to the Gastown clock, great selection of beers, music was nostalgic and wasnt too busy.

How fantastic what a find. Matt and Elena are the best find in Vancouver for the best customer service. They made us have such a great night. The Yorkies chicken wings and Halibut were soo good. Don t miss the brownies for desert soo good and enough to share. We tried some great beer and made some great memories thank you xxx

Great spot! Made room for 3 of us right away, with another 2 that joined later. Cold beers, hot food (wings were quality) and a great view of the steamclock / good people watching. Have nothing bad to say about our experience.
Cool place! Went with a homie and sat at the bar. Cool atmosphere and good drinks! Definitely will go again! If you haven t already, worth checking out!

We were waiting for the steam clock to go off and saw Black Frog Eatery. Decided to give it a try. Set outside away from the crowds. Ordered the Moon Burger but with chicken breast and soup was vegetable borscht. Both were wonderful. Lager was excellent. Enjoyed thoroughly. Only one thing was garbage truck picking up right by the establishment an making a 3 point turn. Still a nice bar and eatery.

Wow, found the Black Frog, tucked away behind the steam clock in Gas town after a stop at a few other establishments, with 10 hours to kill waiting for a flight .  Amazing staff and customer service and a great atmosphere with all the right options on the drink and food menu!    Thanks to the owner and the great staff (Nemo, Sally and Taylor) for making me feel welcome from the start.  I only wish I found it earlier, it would have saved me on my quest for a super cool place to hang and waste away an afternoon in Vancouver.   I WILL be back!!
Stopped for a drink, great choice of beers and Ales, and helpful barman.
Good spot for a pint and meal. Great local beer selection and menu had all the variety you needed. We got the chicken fingers and spinach salad - both were good!

My partner and I just started going to the black frog. Firstly, its super inviting and fun. Especially when the Oilers play. Secondly, the service is great. We have had the luck of being served by Elena a few times. I have been in the hospitality industry for over 17 years and I can tell she is on point. Very quick constant service. The way she scans the bar non stop and helps people was great. Her personality was the perfect balance between fun, friendly and respectful. Thank you black frog!

This place was a cherry on top of my time in Vancouver! The atmosphere is awesome and the service was super friendly! Also the best music!!!! Thank you to everyone at black frog Vegetarian options: Delicious veggie wrap

Absolutely delicious food and great service. I don t think I ve ever tipped that much but the server just did an outstanding work. Had happy hour mussels and Caesar salad - super tasty, though had 2-3 shells without mussel in it and since it a smaller happy hour portion it was a bit sad. Anyways, will definitely come back and try more of your dishes
Stopped by for as appetizer and beverage. The app was good and the drinks were delicious. The staff was very friendly and the service was very good.
Excellent food, excellent beer selection. This place is filled with Edmonton Oilers and Eskimo items. One of the bartenders mentioned it was an Oilers bar. The Oilers game was on all the tvs.
LOVED this place. Great drink selection and super friendly staff. Will definitely visit again!

This bar is an Oilers bar. It was the perfect place for me to watch the Flames beat the Oilers last night. The friendly banter back and forth with the other customers was fun. The drinks here were good and so were the wings. No issues with the service.
What a delicious hamburger with beef bbq we ate yesterday evening! And chicken wings with garlic honey were perfect too with two cold Philipss beers. Great experience in the sunny patio
Thank God, a normal pub with nice drinks and good food. Hard to find that these days.
We really enjoyed our time at Black Frog. It was cozy, and te food and service was great!

If youre looking for a laid back atmosphere with a cheers vibe, look no further. This is a neighborhood haunt for me so Ive been a handful of times. Food is good and drinks are decent. I mean, dont expect the best old fashioned of your life but expect a mighty delicious moscow mule made with quality ginger beer for a truly unbeatable price. Drinks here are a bit cheaper than the norm!
Great patio to sit on, close to the waterfront. Watched one of  the cruiseships leave. Close to the steam clock in the heart of Gastown
Nice little pup in the heart of Gastown. Our group ordered the Beef Dip, Hamburger and Fish & Chips. Everything was excelled. Service was great.
Really enjoyed my evening here. Definitely a friendly place with some great characters! Definitely worth a stop. Also, try Creepy Uncle Dunkel beer. lol
Love their patio. Good and service was great
Came across this place while looking for a quick snack and a place to warm up. The wings are incredible and the server was great! Nice location within gastown

We greatly enjoyed the mellow atmosphere,  initially we began our evening at The Cambie but since it changed hands its become the biggest suck job on Cordova.  You are much better off walking down a block and hitting the Black Frog, the food is much better and the booze options are infinitely .  No one has ever had a great time drinking bud on tap.  Go to the Black Frog where the service is wonderful and the fare is just as wonderful.  Go there!  You want be disappointed.
Loved it. Great food, excellent service
Great place for a pint and good pub food. I had the moon burger. it was delicious and filling. I will def be returning!

Love this place! I go here for dates all the time and the staff is always friendly. I especially like the server with the short red and blonde hair, she is quick and funny and always makes me feel at home. Food is great and I try a new drink every time I go.

Excellent atmosphere, good prices, yummy grub, and great service! I spent a solid 4 hours enjoying the food, drink and conversation. Scott, Jory, and their co-worker (didnt catch the name) were pleasant, welcoming and provided a relaxed and comfortable atmosphere. Covid safe and a great way to get out during these difficult times. Thank you Black Frog!

My favorite Bar in Gastown! Staff is super friendly and approachable. Great selection of cocktails, beer, food etc Vibe is great, right beside Steamclock. And the people are very laid back and chill. Ive been coming since I arrived in Vancouver and have never been disappointed! Everything you want in a local bar downtown

this place is honestly so amazing and wholesome. i just was walking through gastown during a literal DOWNPOUR. and i ended up here. honestly i was greeted with so much kindness and hospitality it amazed me. i had no idea what to order or anything and the server i think her name was taylor she knew exactly what she was doing and had amazing service. she was very positive and kind. it was sorta busy at the time but she constantly made sure i had everything i needed.

I honestly love the place. As an Oilers fan living in Vancouver it s a nice slice of home. As the only Oilers bar in Vancouver they serve as a much needed refuge for us Oilers fan in a sea of Canucks. They are friendly and do their best to keep their Oilers atmosphere (if the Oilers are playing and you don t watch hockey it s best to avoid it). They have a decent menu, beer lineup, and they re a stone throw from the steam clock in the waterfront. Give them the work if you re an Oilers fan or if you re just a fan of a good pub in a the waterfront area. They ll take care of you. And personally a good old tip of the hat from me to them, for making a home sick Edmonton boy feel at home. Cheers to you guys, thanks for everything see you next season.

Loved this place! The atmosphere was great. Staff was super friendly and overall, just on it when it came to service. Prices were better than anything else we saw in the area. Plus, no cover like the other places were charging! I had the chicken strips with fries and they were cooked to perfection.

Its an Edmonton Oilers bar in Vancouver. Doesnt get any cooler than that. Service was great. Food is okay. Definitely a place to have beers and cocktails though. Just an awesome atmosphere. You even get the sound to the game.

Izzy the bartender was awesome. Great knowledge of the beer. And was very helpful when our order was incorrect to fix it for us. The environment was great. Fun place to go to watch an Oilers game. Even though they arent doing so well. Will be back again
Great service, food and selection of beers Quite a nice place for lunch.
Good beer at reasonable prices Good food at reasonable prices Great bar!!

I have found since COVID, it s been really hard to find some good service. My girlfriend and I live right between Gas Town and Coal Harbour, so we have visited tons of restaurants and bars since we moved here. Jory at Black Frog is now by far the best server/bartender we have ever had, he is so kind, fast and reactive. Thanks for finally scratching that itch for awesome service we were waiting for, you re the man Jory!!

Found this gem in gastown. Stopped in for lunch and some  drink.  Great cozy pub atmosphere.  Loved the stuffed mini Yorkshire puddings and the hubby enjoyed the Diablo chicken sandwich..  Staff was very knowledgeable on all their local craft beer.  Would definitely will stop in again.

What a bar! A diverse drink menu presented in a very west coast fashioned location. The service we received was very intuitive to our needs which is highly appreciated. The chef has definitely put some spins on classic pub food that really show during every bite

Good beer.  Good food. The moon burger with melted brie and caramelized onions was fantastic! As were the yam fries with curry mayo! Music is usually pretty good too if you like 90s alternative. I like that its in a short alley in Gastown.
I rarely throw out 5 stars, but black frog is a cut above the rest and deserves it. Extremely clean, inviting warm atmosphere, excellent draught and scotch selection. Exceptional service.

First time going there, I ordered the barbecue chicken burger with Caesar salad , it was excellent! Wasnt too busy when I went there, but slowly started to get busier as the evening went on, if Im ever in downtown Vancouver again I would definitely eat there. Prices are quite reasonable as well
Good pub food. Good staff. A local unpretentious favorite.
Food, service and location are perfect! The terrasse is beautiful and the view is fantastic. You can see and hear the steam clock pretty well. I have eaten the Moon Burger and it was sooo tasty.

This is the perfect hidden gem for a great beer list, and great food. In fact the whole menu is good. Its got that classic Cheers feel and you and your friends will want to go again and again for a weekly pint.

We were walking around Gastown and stopped here for a early dinner. You could see the steam clock from the restaurant. The day we were there the Gastown Grand Prix was going on and the start/finish line, stage, awards was all right there by the restaurant. The pork rinds we ordered were not good but the rest of the food wasnt bad. We stopped in here on a Sunday afternoon. Cool seating where we could see the steam clock. Service was great , food was amazing! We started with poutine and fresh pork rinds. Then I had the roast beef sandwich. Omg,one word- gravy. It was so yummy.

My favorite spot for a quick bite or drink while in the neighborhood. In the tourism district of Gastown, there are lots of bars trying to stand out, but the Black Frog does so effortlessly and unpretentiously. Tucked away behind a Starbucks right by the train tracks, they are reasonably priced, with good quality food and wait staff. Also (and this is coming from a bar manager) this might be one of the cleanest bars in all of the city!

One of the few locally owned pubs in Vancouver.  Best wings in town and you gotta try the yorkies. They always have a good selection of beer on draft and the location in gas town couldn t be better or more accessible by transit.
A bit off the crowded main strip, but still a nice view of the steam clock from our table. Staff and food was great as well.
Great food!  Even salads were good. Great draft beer. Great service. Real find!

This pub style restaurant is in Gastown and close to the Steam Clock which is the only one in the world. This place offers simple meals, I has a steak and onion sandwich with chips and my husband had a veal dish served with roast potatoes and vegetables. Both were very well cooked and tasty. There arent many reasonably priced places to eat in the city but this wasnt too expensive and is above the quality of others in the area.
Halibut and chips were perfectly prepared! And youre right next to the Steam Clock. Excellent service, too!

My favourite spot in Gastown. It s my go-to for a pint or two. Great service and a solid selection of beer. Good spot to catch the game as well, just don t expect to see the Canucks game if the Oilers are playing!

Little piece of Edmonton in Van City! The Black Frog is located near the water, just past that silly Steam Clock (which you will hear frequent patrons groan about as it rings at the top of every hour! ). The Black Frog offers amazing in-house specials including, an Edmonton street food favorite, green onion cakes! The last time I went, I ordered the Pork schnitzel burger, and was raving about it for a week! Everytime Ive gone, there has never been a wait time for a spot to sit. The menu prices are very reasonable (nothing higher than 30$), drink menu is solid and changes from time to time (they have very good specials depending on when you go), and the service is very friendly and attentive. They play sports on the televisions and hang regalia of national, and international soccer teams on their walls, in the form of warm scarves! This pub truly is a little slice of Edmonton in the bustling Vancouver downtown. Feel free to strike up conversation, or try your hand at beating the pinball machine in the corner (I hear they love new names on the leaderboard!)
Well stocked bar, very personable staff.
Great vibes. If youre downtown and dont want somewhere thats over priced or stuffy this is the place for you. Genuinely super comfy. Good beer list and a great brownie.

Used to visit this place all the time. Lovely drinks and  food. I love the long-island iced tea. Small and quiet, so it s good for a date or small group of friends :) good location as well in a heart of gasstown, located right infront of the steam clock. I think I have to go back to this place when I go dt next time
Fun little dive next to the harbor. The schnitzel was excellent.
Favorite little pub in Gastown. Catch Oilers games here for a rowdy evening. Good staff, good beers, decent food. Not usually too crowded when everything else is.
Always a good time here.  Never too busy (unless an Oilers game is playing.  Great, laidback atmosphere.  Great beer prices, decent food. Always end up finding myself here when in Gastown area
Great spot right near the steam clock. The food was delicious. I had a club sandwich and soup and it was great. Also the cocktails were very nice.
Best place ever.  Awesome bar tender.
Comfortable Gastown drinking establishment without a pretentious atmosphere. The small brewery draft selection and ciders are fantastic. Great place for watching sports.
Very nice location tucked back off the main street.  Nice selection of local beverages and tasty food.
Great wait staff and delicious food too. Great place to go if youre looking for something to munch on. Id add a 6th star for the friendly tall blonde server, if I could.
Great drink specials, good food and a solid beer selection. Very accommodating. I highly recommend this place for just chilling at a bar.

Very quaint and friendly staff. From everything positive I had heard of Black Frog the experience i recieved was terrific. From the service, the food and the magnificent view of Canada Place, please attend and keep this establishment a cornerstone of the Gastown Community
Casual dining in Gastown with a nice view of the steam clock. Our cheerful server Bella was very helpful and gave my out of town visitors a very warm welcome to Vancouver.
Hit the spot.  We were tired after a long flight from Europe and the BF was just what we needed. Great beer. Good service and tasty snacks. Thanks BF
Service was amazing. Atmosphere is very welcoming. Had the Reuben and so tasty. I recommend this place to anyone just wanting a casual place to chill out.
Always consistent; Great staff, food and of course the hockey games. Its quiet out these days, show some support of an awesome establishment!
Excellent food and drinks, great friendly service. The perogies were really excellent. Good local IPA. Highly recommend.
A nice , unpretentious place off Water street in a quiet spot with views of the harbour and Canada Place.  Perfect stop after a trip through Gas Town!
Great food and service! Dietary restrictions: Gluten free options were available for those of us with allergies! Food : 5/5 |
If you know the black dog then the black frog started from the same owners. Always great for a late night beverage.
Cheap but excellent food! Moon burger had amazing caramelized onions. Fries were a bit salty for my taste.
Great food and service.
Nice beer selection and the poutine and honey garlic wings were delicious. Still serving food at 10pm on a Monday night so that was a bonus.
Good place for a beer, even if its an oiler bar
Always a good time with good music and drinks. Great food amazing service will always look forward to my next visit!
Great playlist, great pricing and the beef dip I got was generously portioned. It was my first time there but it definitely wouldnt be my last
Good food, very friendly staff, nice view of Gastown while you are there. The only downside is its an Oilers bar.
We had a lovely experience. We went with Sarahs drink recommendations and she acknowledged us right when we walked in. Service was very down to Earth.
Amazing place!! If you re an Oilers Fan, it s a must!! Bartender and servers, Amazing!!
Food was good. Beer list was decent. I was from out-of-town and the server gave me an awesome list of places to check-out
Very friendly staff comfortable atmosphere very good food and drinks and very reasonably priced  5 gold stars
One of my favorite pubs! If you are an oilers fan youll love it. Great local beer selection
Best place to watch an Oilers game in Vancouver. Worth the wait if you are an Oilers fan.
Atmosphere is great and nice view there.  Service are nice they always happy to share with. Is a good place and price for us we always visit there.
Attentive staff, good food, great selection of beer, nice space. Love it here!
Best Edmonton Oilers bar Ive ever been to.
One of my favourite gastown pubs. Quiet, cozy, and friendly, with plenty of good beers to choose from. Check it out!
I really like this place because there arent a plethora of TVs on every inch of wall space. One of the only pubs in Vancouver that is actually a pub and not just a sports bar with a pub-theme.
Hidden Gem. Perfect place for a cheeky beer. Friendly staff, good menu - this would be my local if I were a little more handy.
